_exec_summary.SummaryText:
BAXTER HEALTHCARE CORPORATION OF PUERTO RICO (BAXTER), A SUBSIDIARY OF BAXTER IV CO. MANUFACTURES INHALED ANESTHETICS IN ITS FACILITIES LOCATED IN STATE ROAD 3, KM. 142.5, IN GUAYAMA, PUERTO RICO. ITS NAICS CODE IS 32541.

THE BAXTER GUAYAMA TEAM IS VERY COMPROMISED WITH THE PROTECTION OF THE ENVIRONMENT AND THE HEALTH AND SAFETY OF OUR EMPLOYEES AND NEIGHBORS.  THE EHS (ENVIRONMENTAL, HEALTH & SAFETY) DIRECTOR REPORTS DIRECTLY TO THE PLANT MANAGER AND WE ASSURE THAT EVERY JOB, TASKS, PROJECT, ETCA? THAT ITA?S PERFORM HAVE BEEN ASSESS IN TERMS OF EHS.  FOR THE PROCESS SAFETY PROGRAM AND RISK MANAGEMENT PROGRAM OTHER STAFF MEMBERS, SUCH AS MAINTEANCE AND ENGINEER DIRECTOR HAVE RESPONSIBILTY IN THE PROGRAM TO ASSURE ALL THE CHANGES AND REPAIRS FOLLOW THE GOOD ENGINEERING PRACTICES.
  
FOR THE NEW EMPLOYEES, AS PART OF THE NEW EMPLOYEE TRANINING, WE DISCUSS THE BASICS OF THE PSM & RMP PROGRAMS AND THEIR IMPORTANCE NO MATTER IF THE EMPLOYEE IS NOT GOING TO WORK IN A PROCESS THAT ITA?S COVERED BY THE RULE.  ANNUALLY IN THE ALL EMPLOYEE HAZARD COMMUNICATION PROGRAM WE DISCUSS THE RISKS AND PRECAUIONS WITH THE COVERED SUBSTANCES.

AS PART OF OUR MANUFACTURING PROCESSES, THE FOLLOWING REGULATED SUBSTANCES ARE MANAGED AT THE FOLLOWING COVERED PROCESSES IN THE FOLLOWING MAXIMUM QUANTITIES (IN LBS):

1)   HYDROFLUORIC ACID, ANHYDROUS 100% CAS NO. 7664-39-3:
THIS SUBSTANCE IS FOUND ABOVE TRESHOLD LIMITS IN THE MANUFACTURING PROCESSES KNOWN AS DESFLURANE AND SEVOFLURANE.  THERE IS ONE STORAGE TANK FOR THE SUBSTANCE(65,386 LBS.BASED ON FULL CAPACITY) , FROM THIS TANK EACH MANUFACTURING PROCESS TRANSFER THE SUBSTANCE TO A SHOT POT (TRANSFER VESSEL).  THERE IS ONE SHOT POT FOR THE DESFLURANE PROCESS AND ONE FOR THE SEVOFLURANE PROCESS.  FROM THE SHOT POT THE SUBSTANCE IS TRANSFER TO THE FLUORINATION REACTOR.  AT THE DESFLURANE PROCESS THERE ARE TWO FLUORINATION REACTORS ALTHOUGH ONLY ONE CAN BE USE AT A TIME.  AT THE SEVOFLURNAE PROCESS THERE IS ONE FLUORINATION REACTOR.
 
2)  CHLO

RINE CAS NO. 7782-505
THIS CHEMICAL IS HANDLED AS A LIQUEFIED GAS IN 2,000 LBS. PRESSURIZED CYLINDERS. CHLORINE ABOVE ITS TRESHOLD LIMIT IS MANAGED AT THE STORAGE RACK WHERE A MAXIMUM OF 72,000 LBS. MAY BE PRESENT.    CHLORINE IS USED IN THE ISOFLURANE AND SEVOFLURANE PROCESS.  BOTH MANUFACTURING PROCESS USED THE CHLORINE IN THEIR RESPECTIVE CHLORINATION REACTIONS.  FOR EACH PROCESS THERE IS A CHLORINE ROOM IN WHICH THE CHLORINE CYLINDERS ARE CONNECTED TO THE SYSTEM FOR THE CHLORINATION REACTION.  THESE ROOMS ARE CLOSED AND ARE CONNECTED TO AN EMERGENCY SCRUBBER. 

BAXTER USED THE ALOHA MODELING AND THE RMPComp V. 1.07 FOR THE OFFSITE CONSEQUENCE ANALYSIS REQUIRED.  THESE GUIDELINES RECOGNIZE THE OVERPREDICTION BY THE METHODOLOGY USED OF OFFSITE CONSEQUENCES AND THE DISTANCES TO ENDPOINTS. 
                                                                                                                                                                               BEING SUBJECT TO PSM REQUIREMENTS UNDER OSHA'S 29 CFR 1910.119, ALL COVERED PROCESSES FALL UNDER THE REQUIREMENTS OF A PROGRAM 3 PREVENTION PROGRAM. THE FOLLOWING ELEMENTS ARE IN EFFECT FOR ALL PROCESSES WITHIN BAXTER, INCLUDING COVERED PROCESSES.

STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES GOVERN MOST OF THE ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED IN BAXTER. THE ONSITE ENGINEERING DEPARTMENT MAINTAINS A COLLECTION OF DOCUMENTS AND DRAWINGS WHICH CONTAIN INFORMATION ON THE PROCESSES, PROCESS EQUIPMENT AND DESIGN CODES, AMONG OTHERS. MATERIAL BATCH RECORDS (MBR) AND STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES (SOPA?S) UNDER THE CUSTODY OF QA/QC PROVIDE SPECIFIC INSTRUCTIONS FOR THE DIFFERENT STEPS IN EACH MANUFACTURING PROCESS. TRAINING OF PLANT PERSONNEL IS BASED ON CURRICULAE DEVELOPED FOR THE DIFFERENT POSITIONS/RESPONSIBILITIES, USING CONTRACTED OR ONSITE RESOURCES. TRAINING RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED IN HARD COPY AND BY A COMPUTERIZED SYSTEM KNOWN AS "IsoTrain".

AGGRESSIVE PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE IS CONDUCTED UNDER A FORMAL PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE PROGRA

M WHICH INCLUDES CORRESPONDING SOPS. SHUTDOWNS ARE SCHEDULED THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. MECHANICAL INTEGRITY TESTING IS CONDUCTED BASED ON THE REQUIREMENTS BY APPLICABLE DESIGN CODES, STANDARDS AND REGULATIONS, BY SPECIALIZED CONTRACTORS (I.E., BOILERS AND PROCESS VESSELS) AND BY ONSITE PERSONNEL.

STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES ARE ALSO IN EFFECT FOR PRE-STARTUP REVIEWS, MANAGEMENT OF CHANGE, HOT WORK PERMITS, INCIDENT INVESTIGATIONS, PARTICIPATION AND CONTRACTORS' SAFETY. COMPLIANCE AUDITS ARE REGULARLY CONDUCTED AND COMPLY WITH RMP PROGRAM ELEMENTS. 
THERE ARE ALSO WRITTEN GUIDES FOR EACH ELEMENT OF THE PSM PROGRAM.

FULLY EQUIPPED AND TRAINED EMERGENCY RESPONSE BRIGADES WILL RESPOND TO ALL RELEASE INCIDENTS. THE EMERGENCY RSPONSE PLAN LAST REVISED IN 2008 PROVIDES PROCEDURES FOR RESPONDING TO THESE EMERGENCIES, INCLUDING NOTIFICATIONS TO THE COMMUNITY AND SUMMONING EMERGENCY MEDICAL ASSISTANCE. SOPHISTICATED SYSTEMS OF DETECTORS, ALARMS, AND FIRE FIGHTING EQUIPMENT HELP REDUCE THE EFFECT OF ANY RELEASES. BAXTER HAS BEEN AN ACTIVE PARTICIPANT IN THE LEPC FOR GUAYAMA SINCE ITS APPOINTMENT IN 1987. COORDINATION FOR EMERGENCIES IS ACCOMPLISHED BY MEETINGS WITH STATE FIRE DEPARTMENT AND OTHER EMERGENCY GROUPS.  THE FIRE DEPARTMENT MEETS PERIODICALLY WITH OUR EMERGENCY RESPONSE COORDINATOR AND DRILLS ARE CONDUCTED THROUGH THE YEAR WITH THEM.  LAST DRILL WAS LAST MONTH IN A PRACTICE TO USE THE CHLORINE KIT.

WHEN COMPARED THIS RESUBMISSION WITH 2004 SUBMITTAL THE COVERED PROCESS, INVENTORY OF COVERED SUBSTANCES AND THE OPERATING SYSTEMS ARE THE SAME.  IN 2004 THE SEVOFLURANE PROCESS WAS REPORTED AS PREDICTIVE FILLING.  FOR THIS SUBMISSION THE SEVOFLURANE PROCESS WAS INCLUDED AND DIVIDED IN TWO COVERED PROCESS; CHLORINATION AND FLUORINATION.
